messages: 733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:00): yes I got that "auto close windows" settings on
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:01): no, that means that there is some internationalisation message missing or that something is wrong with the text stuff
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:01): but what setting are you talking about?
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:03): I am on British English setting
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:04): did you get the file?
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:04): I can't reach the setting with this prefs window, it is missing the "categories" names
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:05): try debug -> reload messagebundle
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:06): It is "Interface/Alerts/Automatically Hide non-error popup alerts after x seconds", my setting is "15"
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:07): what about it?
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:07): you asked "what setting are you talking about" , I was talking about that setting
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:08): well... according to the screenshot you got that everywhere
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:08): but it is not related of course
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:08): not just on that particular setting
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:08): now I understand why debug menu has "reload message bundle" :)
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:09): well, not really...
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:09): its purpose is to reload it when you modify the file in the IDE while azureus is running
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:10): since we can replace code while azureus is running, but not the text file
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:12): when you are free, Sci-Fi guys put Battestar Galactica promos to Vuze
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:12): Nolar: I got some ideas but won't post them to public, are you there?
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:15): i heard we'll get a community management guy next week, so maybe you can pitch your ideas to him, if they're content platform related
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:17): they are but I don't want competitors to pick them :)
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:19): that would work too
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:28): Ilgaz, fixed the magnet link error btw
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:29): i don't build those

733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:46): The_8472: people say Leopard is very strict, here is an example from a C++ program Break on __THE_PROCESS_HAS_FORKED_AND_YOU_CANNOT_USE_THIS_COREFOUNDATION_FUNCTIONALITY___YOU_MUST_EXEC__() to debug.
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:46): poor gnome control center, farewell to it lol
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:47): now you understand why I am impressed that Azureus is one of the non problematic apps on Leopard
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:47): thanks to being Java I guess
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:48): although we have issues with subtle platform differences too
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:48): especially due to swt
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:52): The_8472: so if one launches embedded media player, it is same as running a recent mplayer on same system yes?
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:53): I am asking since I got a Mac Mini G4 upstairs

733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:54): The_8472: When Apple released Intel Mac mini, all G4 mini owners moved to it and figured it lacks a real graphics card and fails to do things which G4 Mini with ATI does
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:54): Integrated i950 I heard, pure evil thing which even MS couldn't handle

733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:55): lacks a OpenGL function or something
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:56): i don't know what cover flow is
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:56): as i don't use itunes

733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (06:58): Of course it is not 15 fps with such horrible quality
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:59): oh... just a fancy switcher
8fa2d0067f92fbec7c550e8068f91809 (06:59): reminds me of compiz
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (07:01): Apple paid million dollar for it or something

733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (07:01): of course Apple has put it in entire Leopard via API
733cdf60e2c72451088871005ff13319 (07:01): and Finder uses it too
